issues.description: The problem statement and UML specify a static method named `acceptSupplyDelivery(String, int, int)`, but the solution implementation provides a static method named `receiveDelivery(String, int, int)` instead of `acceptSupplyDelivery`. This name mismatch will confuse students and cause their implementation to fail tests expecting `acceptSupplyDelivery`.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the solution’s `receiveDelivery` method to `acceptSupplyDelivery`, matching the exact name and signature (`public static void acceptSupplyDelivery(String name, int price, int quantity)`) described in the problem statement and UML.

issues.description: The problem statement specifies a static method `acceptSupplyDelivery` in the SealSaloon class (taking parameters `(String, int, int)`), but the solution implements this functionality under a differently named method `receiveDelivery`. This discrepancy can confuse students when mapping the specified API to the reference implementation.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the `receiveDelivery` method in SealSaloon to `acceptSupplyDelivery` (with signature `public static void acceptSupplyDelivery(String name, int price, int quantity)`) to align the reference implementation with the problem specification.
